page.title: 05Some History of Fraserburgh
page.content: Fraserburgh was named in{1592}by {Royal Decree of James VI}after {Alexander Fraser of Philorth}made improvements to the town. The village of{Faithlie,}as the town was known before, had existed on the site from well{before 1370. For a short time after 1592 a {university}was run in the town, and now it is remembered in the street name{"College Bounds". The{fishing industry}is the town's main claim to fame and{sea-faring}has been associated with{Kinnaird Head}for a very long time. { Kinnaird Head Lighthouse}is built on the remains of the{Frasers' castle}and other notable buildings are{"Warld's {End",}the{Wine Tower,}and{Dalrymple {Hall. J.Cranna's book{"Fraserburgh Past & {Present"}is a good source of history.
